HILLWOOD QUARRY NEAR NEWBRIDGE
We interviewed a local resident who lives beside Hillwood Quarry.We asked her how the Quarry affects her life.She told use that her windows were always covered with dust,that she had to wash her washing at least 3 times, that her whole house shakes when the Quarry is blasting and the last blast is at 7p.m.She thinks 150 lorries pass the house each day taking rough gravel and tarmac to the new road on the Corstorphine outskirts of Edinburgh.The dust causes sore eyes and sore throats. It is impossible to sit out in the sun or to grow fruit and vegetables because of the white dust which blows from the backs of uncovered lorries.
